multiple_choice_question.text: What property of the simple graph H shown in Figure 1 is being illustrated?
choices: H is a counterexample to Theorem 1.7.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the simple graph H4 depicted in Figure 2?
choices: It demonstrates a graph with cfan(H4) = 1, but no full B-queue.
It represents a graph where a full B-queue exists, but cfan(H4) > 0.
It illustrates a graph with cfan(H4) = 0 that does not have a full B-queue.
It is a counterexample to the claim that all simple graphs have a full B-queue.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of Formula (1) in the context of Vizing\'s Fan Inequality?
choices: It defines the fan-degree of a pair of vertices.
It provides a lower bound on the chromatic index of a graph.
It establishes a condition under which a partial edge-coloring cannot be extended.
It calculates the maximum edge-multiplicity of a subgraph.
